channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: When It Comes To Policymaking, The Rules Don't Apply To Climate Change
item.description: April 20, 2017 - On Saturday, people from around the country will take to the streets in the March for Science. Organizers say that the point of the March is not to make science political, but to highlight the reality of science to politicians, as a guide in policymaking, in which science is an uncharted issue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - On Saturday, people from around the country will take to the streets in the March for Science. Organizers say that the point of the March is not to make science political, but to highlight the reality of science to politicians, as a guide in policymaking, in which science is an uncharted issue. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/20/524936065/when-it-comes-to-policymaking-the-rules-dont-apply-to-climate-change

item.title: Researchers Find Yet Another Reason Why Naked Mole-Rats Are Just Weird
item.description: April 20, 2017 - The hairless, ground-dwelling, cold-blooded rodents have proven capable of surviving total oxygen deprivation. Their odd biology allows them to run on an alternative fuel.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - The hairless, ground-dwelling, cold-blooded rodents have proven capable of surviving total oxygen deprivation. Their odd biology allows them to run on an alternative fuel. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/20/524511231/researchers-find-yet-another-reason-why-naked-mole-rats-are-just-weird

item.title: Astronaut, Cosmonaut And Stuffed Dog Arrive At International Space Station
item.description: April 20, 2017 - It's the first mission to space for American Jack Fischer, who says there is one aspect of space station life that you can't train for on Earth: using a zero-gravity toilet.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - It's the first mission to space for American Jack Fischer, who says there is one aspect of space station life that you can't train for on Earth: using a zero-gravity toilet. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/20/524883853/astronaut-cosmonaut-and-stuffed-dog-arrive-at-international-space-station

item.title: Electrical Stimulation To Boost Memory: Maybe It's All In The Timing
item.description: April 20, 2017 - Research in epilepsy has found a key to why small pulses of electricity to the brain sometimes help and sometimes hurt a failing memory. Brains hurt by physical trauma or dementia might benefit, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - Research in epilepsy has found a key to why small pulses of electricity to the brain sometimes help and sometimes hurt a failing memory. Brains hurt by physical trauma or dementia might benefit, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/20/524374825/electrical-stimulation-to-boost-memory-maybe-its-all-in-the-timing

item.title: How Do Former Opioid Addicts Safely Get Pain Relief After Surgery?
item.description: April 20, 2017 - Max Baker got treatment for his opioid dependency and kicked the habit. He'd been clean for more than a year when a car accident and subsequent surgery returned him to addiction's spiral.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - Max Baker got treatment for his opioid dependency and kicked the habit. He'd been clean for more than a year when a car accident and subsequent surgery returned him to addiction's spiral. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/20/519481712/how-do-former-opioid-addicts-safely-get-pain-relief-after-surgery

item.title: Human Umbilical Cord Blood Helps Aging Mice Remember, Study Finds
item.description: April 19, 2017 - Researchers found that a protein in human umbilical cord plasma improved learning and memory in older mice, but there's no indication it would work in people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - Researchers found that a protein in human umbilical cord plasma improved learning and memory in older mice, but there's no indication it would work in people. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/19/523975844/human-umbilical-cord-blood-helps-aging-mice-remember-study-finds

item.title: An Asteroid Is Swinging By Earth Today For Its Closest Visit In 400 Years
item.description: April 19, 2017 - Don't worry: Astronomers say asteroid 2014 JO25, which is more than a third of a mile wide, will fly harmlessly past our planet. Still, it should come close enough to be visible with small telescopes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - Don't worry: Astronomers say asteroid 2014 JO25, which is more than a third of a mile wide, will fly harmlessly past our planet. Still, it should come close enough to be visible with small telescopes. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/19/524680317/an-asteroid-is-swinging-by-earth-today-for-its-closest-visit-in-400-years

item.title: FDA Approval Of Hepatitis C Drugs For Kids Is Likely To Speed Treatment
item.description: April 19, 2017 - Many insurers have required that adults with hepatitis C be very sick before they can get access to expensive drug treatment. But Medicaid has special rules that may get kids and teens access sooner.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - Many insurers have required that adults with hepatitis C be very sick before they can get access to expensive drug treatment. But Medicaid has special rules that may get kids and teens access sooner. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/19/524373963/fda-approval-of-hepatitis-c-drugs-for-kids-is-likely-to-speed-treatment

item.title: WATCH: NASA Livestreams 360-Degree View Of Rocket Launch
item.description: April 18, 2017 - A special 360-degree camera was installed on the launch pad near the base of the Atlas V rocket heading to the International Space Station.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - A special 360-degree camera was installed on the launch pad near the base of the Atlas V rocket heading to the International Space Station. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/18/524508253/watch-live-nasa-livestreams-360-degree-view-of-rocket-launch

item.title: Researchers Examine The Psychology Of Protest Movements
item.description: April 18, 2017 - Social science researchers examine whether extreme protest tactics are an effective way for recruiting popular support. The public may not be relating to protesters like the way protesters aimed for.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - Social science researchers examine whether extreme protest tactics are an effective way for recruiting popular support. The public may not be relating to protesters like the way protesters aimed for. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/18/524473948/researchers-examine-the-psychology-of-protest-movements

item.title: Nonprofit Working To Block Drug Imports Has Ties To Pharma Lobby
item.description: April 18, 2017 - An organization campaigning against foreign drug imports has deep connections to the lobbying group PhRMA, which includes Eli Lilly, Pfizer and Bayer, an analysis by Kaiser Health News reveals.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - An organization campaigning against foreign drug imports has deep connections to the lobbying group PhRMA, which includes Eli Lilly, Pfizer and Bayer, an analysis by Kaiser Health News reveals. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/18/524363014/nonprofit-working-to-block-drug-imports-has-ties-to-pharma-lobby

item.title: In The Rockies, Climate Change Spells Trouble For Cutthroat Trout
item.description: April 18, 2017 - Native cutthroat trout, an iconic part of the mountain West, thrive in cold streams. But warmer weather has allowed invaders to move in — and it's killing off the cutthroats.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - Native cutthroat trout, an iconic part of the mountain West, thrive in cold streams. But warmer weather has allowed invaders to move in — and it's killing off the cutthroats. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/18/523406934/in-the-rockies-climate-change-spells-trouble-for-cutthroat-trout

item.title: Home-Based Drug Treatment Program Costs Less And Works
item.description: April 17, 2017 - Treating addiction is expensive and patients often relapse. A new company is offering better results at a price that's lower in the long run — and clients get treatment right at home.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - Treating addiction is expensive and patients often relapse. A new company is offering better results at a price that's lower in the long run — and clients get treatment right at home. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/17/523016186/home-based-drug-treatment-program-costs-less-and-works

item.title: Peep Show: Watch Us Calculate The Speed Of Light With Stale Easter Treats
item.description: April 17, 2017 - NPR's Adam Cole demonstrates a science experiment that offers a new use for old Peeps. All you need is a ruler and a microwave.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - NPR's Adam Cole demonstrates a science experiment that offers a new use for old Peeps. All you need is a ruler and a microwave. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/17/523609388/peep-show-watch-us-calculate-the-speed-of-light-with-stale-easter-treats

item.title: Untangling The Mystery Of Why Shoelaces Come Untied
item.description: April 17, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Berkeley have figured out why shoelaces seem to come untied at the worst moments, like when you're running.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Berkeley have figured out why shoelaces seem to come untied at the worst moments, like when you're running. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/17/523636317/untangling-the-mystery-of-why-shoelaces-come-untied
